Build ID: 3.2.1

Steps To Reproduce:
While doing some stepping and debugging, I noticed that all the variables in the 'variable' tab when in debug view disappeared from the window (the window was empty). Upon re-starting eclipse, the following error was displayed in the window:

Unable to create view: Argument not valid

When I click the 'details' button, this exception is displayed:

This happens every time I restart eclipse, and doesn't go away (ie: I can't really debug things any more)

More information:
Think this bug is mis-classified.  Not an "ALF" bug
I -think- this is the right area now. Please forward to the correct project/product if this is not accurate (and assuming that you know where it should go :) ).

This is fixed in 3.3.

If one of the Sash weights became invalid, the easiest way to fix it was to clear the new workspace.  But, the sash weights are saved as a preference, so you can manually fix the invalid values.  With Eclipse not running, you need to find the preferences file and change the setting.

The debug preferences in an Eclipse installation are located in the file:

<workspace loc>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.debug.ui.prefs

The memento you are looking for will looking something like this:

pref_state_memento.org.eclipse.debug.ui.VariableView=<?xml version\="1.0" encoding\="UTF-8"?>\r\n<VariablesViewMemento org.eclipse.debug.ui.SASH_DETAILS_PART\="283" org.eclipse.debug.ui.SASH_VIEW_PART\="716">\r\n<COLUMN_SIZES IMemento.internal.id\="org.eclipse.debug.ui.VARIALBE_COLUMN_PRESENTATION.COL_VAR_VALUE" SIZE\="348"/>\r\n<COLUMN_SIZES IMemento.internal.id\="org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.VARIALBE_COLUMN_PRESENTATION.COL_INSTANCE_ID" SIZE\="146"/>\r\n<COLUMN_SIZES IMemento.internal.id\="org.eclipse.debug.ui.VARIALBE_COLUMN_PRESENTATION.COL_VALUE_TYPE" SIZE\="146"/>\r\n<COLUMN_SIZES IMemento.internal.id\="org.eclipse.debug.ui.VARIALBE_COLUMN_PRESENTATION.COL_VAR_NAME" SIZE\="342"/>\r\n</VariablesViewMemento>

the SASH_DETAILS_PART and SASH_VIEW_PART are the settings you will want to change to the defaults, 6 for the DETAILS and 13 for the VIEW.  Other combinations of numbers will work, usually if you are getting the invalid argument, one of the sash weights got set to something negative or zero.  The bug was fixed in later versions of Eclipse.

The file "<workspace
loc>\.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings\org.eclipse.debug.ui.prefs"

Does not contain any of the mentioned parameters. The file that is currently on my system has the following information:
